text: Today was such an amazing day at school! We learned about dinosaurs in science class and I got to present my project about T-Rex. My teacher said I did a really good job and gave me a gold star. Then during recess, me and my friends played on the playground and we pretended to be explorers discovering new lands. After lunch, we had art class where we painted pictures of our families. I can't wait to show my parents what I made when I get home. School is so much fun when we get to learn new things and be creative together.
label: good

text: I really love spending time with my family on weekends. Every Saturday morning, we make pancakes together and dad lets me help flip them. Sometimes we go to the park and have picnics under the big oak tree. Mom always packs our favorite sandwiches and we bring a frisbee to play with. My little sister likes to collect pretty rocks and leaves while we're there. In the evening, we watch movies together and make popcorn. These are my favorite memories and I feel so lucky to have such a loving family.
label: good

text: My best friend Sarah and I love to have sleepovers at each other's houses. We always plan fun activities like making friendship bracelets, playing board games, and telling silly jokes. Last weekend, we built a fort out of blankets and pillows in her living room and pretended we were camping. We roasted marshmallows in her fireplace and her mom made us hot chocolate. We stayed up late talking about our dreams and what we want to be when we grow up. Having a best friend makes everything more fun and I'm so grateful for our friendship.
label: good

text: Learning about different countries and cultures in social studies is really interesting. Today we studied Japan and learned about their traditions, food, and festivals. I was amazed to learn about cherry blossom season and how families have picnics under the beautiful pink trees. We also learned about origami, which is the art of paper folding. Our teacher showed us how to make paper cranes and we each made one to take home. I want to learn more about different cultures around the world because it helps me understand how diverse and wonderful our planet is.
label: good

text: There's this kid in my class named Tommy who is really annoying and weird. Everyone thinks he's stupid and nobody wants to sit next to him at lunch. Yesterday I told all my friends that we should ignore him completely and not let him play with us at recess. When he tried to join our game, we all walked away and left him standing there alone. I also started a rumor that he wets his pants and now everyone is laughing at him. I think it's funny when he looks sad and cries. Maybe if we keep being mean to him, he'll switch schools and we won't have to deal with him anymore.
label: bad

text: I found this really cool website that shows how to make explosive devices using household items. It has step-by-step instructions with pictures and everything. I'm thinking about trying to make one in my garage when my parents aren't home. I could probably get all the materials from the hardware store without anyone suspecting anything. It would be so awesome to blow something up and see how much damage I could cause. Maybe I could bring it to school and show everyone how smart I am. I bet nobody would mess with me if they knew I could make bombs.
label: bad

text: This older kid at the bus stop has been asking me weird questions about when my parents go to work and if I'm ever home alone. He told me I'm really mature for my age and that we should hang out sometime without telling anyone. He said he has some really cool stuff to show me at his house and that it would be our special secret. He also asked me to send him pictures of myself and wanted to know my exact address. Something about this feels wrong but he says all the cool kids do this kind of stuff and that I should trust him if I want to fit in.
label: bad

text: I hate going to school because everyone there is so stupid and annoying. The teachers are all boring and mean, and my classmates are just a bunch of losers who don't understand how smart I am. I wish I could hurt all of them and make them pay for being so awful to me. Sometimes I think about bringing something dangerous to school to scare everyone and show them who's really in charge. I spend most of my time planning different ways I could get revenge on all the people who have been mean to me. Maybe then they would finally respect me and stop treating me like garbage.
label: bad

Let's keep this just between us - your parents wouldn't understand our friendship.
